links.*: The Lord of the Rings (1955 radio series)
The Mermaid's Flute from 'The Lay of Earendel'

wikitext.*:
{{year-header}}
==Early==
* '''?''' - Being a linguist, Tolkien decides to specialise in signalling, and learns Morse code.
==March==
* '''[[2 March|2]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter 4]].
* '''[[16 March|16]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] receives his degree at the [[University of Oxford]].
* '''[[22 March|22]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] marries [[Edith Tolkien|Edith Bratt]].

==June==
* '''[[2 June|2]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] receives orders to report in Folkestone, and prepare for embarking. 
* '''[[4 June|4]]''' - Tolkien leaves for France.
* '''[[27 June|27]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] leaves [[wikipedia:Étaples|Étaples]], and goes to the [[Battle of the Somme|Somme front]].
*'''?''' - Tolkien might have written the poem ''[[Eruman beneath the Stars|Habbanan beneath the Stars]]''.
==July==
* '''[[1 July|1]]''' - One of the bloodiest battles in recent history, the [[Battle of the Somme]], starts. [[Robert Gilson]] is hit by a shell at La Boiselle on the first day; one of the first of the 360,000 British casualties of that battle.
* '''[[14 July|14]]''' - Tolkien's C-company is sent into action at the Somme front.
* '''[[22 July|22]]''' - [[Ralph Payton|Ralph "the Baby" Payton]], one of the [[T.C.B.S.]], is killed [[World War I|in action]].

==August==
* '''[[12 August|12]]''' - Tolkien writes [[Letter 5]].
* '''[[19 August|19]]''' - Tolkien and [[Geoffrey Bache Smith|G.B. Smith]] meet at Acheux.
==September==
* '''[[13 September|13]]-[[24 September|24]]''' - Revises the poem [[The Mermaid's Flute from 'The Lay of Earendel'|The Mermaid's Flute]] and composes [[Stella Vespertina|Consolatrix Afflictorium]], and [[Stella Vespertina]]
* '''[[19 September|19]]''' - [[Terence Tiller]], writer of the [[The Lord of the Rings (1955 radio series)|1955 radio series of ''The Lord of the Rings]]'', is born.

==October==
* '''[[26 October|26]]''' - While in reserve, [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s battalion is inspected by [[wikipedia:Douglas Haig|Sir Doulgas Haig]], the British commander at the [[Battle of the Somme]].
* '''[[27 October|27]]''' - Tolkien is struck by "pyrexia of unknown origin": [[wikipedia:trench fever|trench fever]].
* '''[[31 October|31]]''' - Canon [[Norman Power]], an acquaintance of [[J.R.R. Tolkien]], is born.
==November==
* '''[[8 November|8]]''' - Tolkien is repatriated, and is sent to a hospital in [[Birmingham]].
* '''[[22 November|22]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] signs [[War Office form 22 November 1916|a form for the War Office]], confirming his return to England from France due to trench fever.
* '''[[29 November|29]]''' - [[Geoffrey Bache Smith|G.B. Smith]] is hit by shrapnel, and wounded on his right arm and thigh.
==December==
* '''[[3 December|3]]''' - G.B. Smith dies of gas-gangrene in his wounds. The news doesn't reach Tolkien until the 16th.
* '''[[16 December|16]]-[[25 December|25]]''' - Tolkien recovers, and he and Edith visit Great Haywood.
* '''[[28 December|28]]''' - [[Noel Johnson]], who would play [[Éomer]] in [[The Lord of the Rings (1955 radio series)|''The Lord of the Rings'' (1955 radio series)]], is born.
{{Years|1913|1914|1915|1916|1917|1918|1919|}}
